question: Which country was the location of the "2006 Kodori Crisis"?
explanation: The 2006 Kodori crisis erupted in Kodori Gorge, the Autonomous Republic of Abkhazia, Georgia in late July 2006, when a local militia leader declared his opposition to the Government of Georgia, which sent police forces to disarm the rebels. The upper part of the Kodori Gorge was at that time the only portion of Abkhazia, Georgia's breakaway republic, not controlled by the Abkhaz authorities. This crisis resulted in the Georgian government victory.
